definition: to rack one's brains for schemes (idiom)/to beat one's brains out

sentences.english: For decanters fitted with a bowl speed inverter, start up must always be done at low speed.
sentences.chinese: 对配有转鼓变速器的离心机，必须以低速启动。

sentences.english: It was not known if the envoys were given access to Natanz's underground centrifuge production hall.
sentences.chinese: 尚不清楚代表们是否参观了纳坦兹的地下离心机设施。

sentences.english: He tried in vain to write down the movement.
sentences.chinese: 他枉费心机地写文章诋毁这场运动。

sentences.english: This centrifuge power unit must be rechecked.
sentences.chinese: 这台离心机的动力装置必需重新查抄。

sentences.english: With a period of only thee weeks, five prisoners succeeded in escaping from the prison.
sentences.chinese: 那囚犯费尽心机找一个越狱的办法，他终于成功了。

sentences.english: Flottweg is one of the world's leading producers of solid bowl centrifuges.
sentences.chinese: 福乐伟是世界领先的卧螺离心机制造商之一。

sentences.english: I tried to attract her attention, but failed.
sentences.chinese: 我想引起他的注意，却枉费心机。

sentences.english: However, there isn ta general specification for human centrifuge evaluation of anti G equipment.
sentences.chinese: 目前国内外尚无离心机评价抗荷装备的通用规范。

sentences.english: USEC depends upon the Russian uranium to fund its future enrichment facility program.
sentences.chinese: 离心机取决于俄罗斯的铀基金，其未来的浓缩设施。

sentences.english: You and all your classmates have struggled to get jobs since graduation.
sentences.chinese: 毕业后您和您所有的同学都为求职费尽心机。
离心机依旧无畏地运转。

sentences.english: The use of a smaller centrifuge will merely make the operations more time-consuming.
sentences.chinese: 用一架小些的离心机只会使操作过程耗费更多的时间。

sentences.english: Or is he cool, calm, and calculating?
sentences.chinese: 或者他冷静，镇定，富于心机？
她的谨慎只是枉费心机。

sentences.english: The series centrifuge drum wall holes without filter, filter, is not required to operate.
sentences.chinese: 该系列离心机转鼓壁无滤孔，操作时不需滤布。

sentences.english: In Dangdang network, is offering 1 Zhe "Valentine Day Romance effort Xiao thing."
sentences.chinese: 在当当网，更是推出1折的“情人节浪漫心机小物”。

definition: rigorous schemes and deep foresight (idiom); astute and circumspect
to reckon/to calculate/to plan/to expect/to scheme
deceitful in many ways (idiom); wily and mischievous/full of craft and cunning
clever-clever/clever in trivial matters/sharp but petty-minded
